intro: Margaritaria nobilis var. antillana, commonly known as the Antillean beautyberry, is a species native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, characterized by its oval, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered, pinkish-white flowers that are followed by spherical, bluish-black berries. These berries are not only ornamental but also contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental landscaping.
